node.title: Endangered right whale gives birth while entangled in ropes
node.alt: Whale entangled in a rope with free newborn next to it
node.description: An endangered North Atlantic right whale caught in a rope since March gives birth to a calf of the US south-eastern coastline.
node.content:
["Scientists have confirmed an endangered right whale has given birth while still entangled in a fishing rope in waters off Georgia, on the US south-eastern coastline.\u00a0", "The North Atlantic right whale was first spotted with a\u00a0fishing rope caught in its mouth in March, but experts\u00a0determined they could not\u00a0safely attempt to help the whale.", "Wildlife Biologist Clay George said the newborn calf appeared healthy and uninjured when an aerial survey team sighted\u00a0it\u00a0alongside its\u00a0mother\u00a0near Cumberland Island.", "It was the second newborn right whale confirmed in the Atlantic waters of the south-eastern US during the species' calving season, which typically runs from December through March.", "", "
Scientists recorded 17 newborn right whale calves during the last winter calving season off the Atlantic coast of the south-eastern US.(AP: Georgia Department of Natural Resources/NOAA Permit #20556)
", "North Atlantic right whales are critically endangered, with scientists estimating that fewer than 350 survive.", "Adult females migrate to warmer waters off Georgia and Florida each winter to give birth.", "Mr George said he was only aware of one other confirmed report\u00a0of an entangled right whale being seen with a newborn.", "However, that report was lodged in\u00a0January 2011 and the\u00a0whale managed to free itself.", "The whale spotted last week, identified by the unique markings on its head, had\u00a0been dragging the\u00a0fishing rope since March.", "That was when it was first reported entangled in Cape Cod Bay, off the coast of Massachusetts.", "Wildlife experts managed to shorten the rope before the whale headed south, but were unable\u00a0to free it.", "\"We haven't seen a chronically entangled whale come down here from up north and have a calf,\" Mr George said.", "He said: \"That's because the mother whale may struggle both to nurse her calf and have the energy needed to keep dragging the fishing line while also trying to recover from potential injuries to its mouth\".", "Female right whales typically gorge themselves in the waters where they feed and mate off New England and Canada before heading south to give birth.", "They won't eat again until they return \u2014 a round trip that can take three months or longer.", "
A failed rescue mission
", "Trained responders in a boat approached the mother whale and calf to attempt to remove or further shorten the fishing rope.", "However, Mr George said they had to abort the high-risk mission after consulting experts.", "Spotters who scan the waters daily for whales and their babies during the calving season plan to keep an eye out for the pair.", "\"My concern is she's still got two pieces of rope, about 20 feet, coming out from the left side of her mouth,\" said Mr George.", "\"If those two pieces of rope ended up getting knotted around each other and there's a loop, you could imagine that calf could end up becoming entangled.\"", "Scientists and advocates with the North Atlantic Right Whale Consortium said in October they suspected the marine mammals lost nearly 10 per cent\u00a0of their population last year, with their overall number falling to an estimated 336.", "Right whales were decimated during the commercial whaling era\u00a0when they were hunted for their oil.", "Now scientists say entanglement with fishing gear and collisions with ships are killing right whales faster than they can reproduce."]
